desc: Happiness held is the seed; Happiness shared is the flower.
author: John Harrigan

desc: Love is the flower you’ve got to let grow.
author: John Lennon

desc: If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden.
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

desc: Take time to smell the roses.
author: Proverb

desc: Love is like wildflowers; it’s often found in the most unlikely places.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

desc: A flower cannot blossom without sunshine, and a man cannot live without love.
author: Max Muller

desc: There are always flowers for those who want to see them.
author: Henri Matisse

desc: What a lonely place it would be to have a world without a wildflower!
author: Roland R. Kemler

desc: I’d rather wear flowers in my hair, than diamonds around my neck.
author: Unknown

desc: Flowers are a proud assertion that a ray of beauty outvalues all the utilities in the world.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

desc: The very best relationship has a gardener and a flower. The gardener nurtures and the flower blooms.
author: Carole Radziwill

desc: The smallest flower is a thought, a life answering to some feature of the Great Whole, of whom they have a persistent intuition.
author: Honore de Balzac

desc: If you tend to a flower, it will bloom, no matter how many weeds surround it.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo

desc: A flower’s appeal is in its contradictions — so delicate in form yet strong in fragrance, so small in size yet big in beauty, so short in life yet long on effect.
author: Terri Guillemets

desc: Flowers don’t tell, they show.
author: Stephanie Skeem

desc: Flowers whisper ‘Beauty!’ to the world, even as they fade, wilt, fall.
author: Dr. SunWolf

desc: Flowers always make people better, happier and more helpful; they are sunshine, food and medicine for the soul.
author: Luther Burbank

desc: You’re only here for a short visit. Don’t hurry, don’t worry. And be sure to smell the flowers along the way.
author: Walter Hagen

desc: If we could see the miracle of a single flower clearly, our whole life would change.
author: Buddha

desc: My love for you blossoms every day.
author: Unknown

desc: If I had a single flower for every time I think about you, I could walk forever in my garden.
author: Claudia Adrienne Grandi

desc: All the flowers of the tomorrows are in the seeds of today.
author: Indian Proverb

desc: Politeness is the flower of humanity
author: Joseph Joubert

desc: Mama was my greatest teacher, a teacher of compassion, love and fearlessness. If love is sweet as a flower, then my mother is that sweet flower of love.
author: Stevie Wonder

desc: The rose is the flower and handmaiden of love – the lily, her fair associate, is the emblem of beauty and purity.
author: Dorothea Dix

desc: She sprouted love like flowers, grew a garden in her mind, and even on the darkest days, from her smile the sun still shined.
author: Erin Hanson

desc: Flowers are like friends; they bring color to your world.
author: Unknown

desc: She is like a wildflower; beautiful, fierce, and free.
author: Unknown

desc: Flowers don’t worry about how they’re going to bloom. They just open up and turn toward the light and that makes them beautiful.
author: Jim Carrey

desc: Open the bloom of your heart and become a gift of beauty to the world.
author: Bryant McGill

desc: Where flowers bloom so does hope.
author: Lady Bird Johnson

desc: Love is flower like; Friendship is like a sheltering tree.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

desc: A flower does not think of competing with the flower next to it. It just blooms.
author: Zen Shin

desc: Minds are like flowers; they open only when the time is right.
author: Stephen Richards

desc: Earth laughs in flowers.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

desc: The flower that follows the sun does so even in cloudy days.
author: Robert Leighton

desc: Every flower must grow through dirt.
author: Laurie Jean Sennott

desc: Even the tiniest of flowers can have the toughest roots.
author: Shannon Mullen

desc: Every flower blooms in its own time.
author: Ken Petti

desc: The butterfly is a flying flower, the flower a tethered butterfly.
author: Ecouchard Le Brun

desc: A flower blooming in the desert proves to the world that adversity, no matter how great, can be overcome.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo

desc: Like wildflowers; You must allow yourself to grow in all the places people thought you never would.
author: E.V.

desc: Don’t wait for someone to bring you flowers. Plant your own garden and decorate your own soul.
author: Luther Burbank

desc: Politeness is the flower of humanity.
author: Joseph Joubert

desc: A flower does not use words to announce its arrival to the world; it just blooms.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo

desc: A rose can never be a sunflower, and a sunflower can never be a rose. All flowers are beautiful in their own way, and that’s like women too.
author: Miranda Kerr

desc: In joy and in sadness, flowers are our constant friends.
author: Unknown

desc: Many eyes go through the meadow, but few see the flowers in it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

desc: To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow.
author: Audrey Hepburn

desc: Don’t let the tall weeds cast a shadow on the beautiful flowers in your garden.
author: Steve Maraboli

desc: Flowers grow back, even after they are stepped on. So will I.
author: Unknown

desc: Spring: A lovely reminder of how beautiful change can truly be.
author: Unknown

desc: Gardens and flowers have a way of bringing people together, drawing them from their homes.
author: Clare Ansberry

desc: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.
author: Victor Hugo

desc: Perfumes are the feelings of flowers.
author: Heinrich Heine

desc: Every flower is a soul blossoming in nature.
author: Gerard de Nerval

desc: Against a dark sky all flowers look like fireworks.
author: G.K. Chesterton

desc: Flowers are restful to look at. They have neither emotions nor conflicts.
author: Sigmund Freud

desc: I must have flowers, always, and always.
author: Claude Monet

desc: A rose by any other name would smell as sweet.
author: William Shakespeare

desc: To plant a garden is to dream of tomorrow.
author: Elizabeth Lawrence

desc: When admiring other people's gardens, don't forget to tend to your own flowers.
author: Sanober Khan

desc: I hope that while so many people are out smelling the flowers, someone is taking the time to plant some.
author: Herbert Rappaport

desc: In my garden, after a rainfall, you can faintly, yes, hear the breaking of new blooms.
author: Truman Capote

desc: Don't just be my garden paradise. Be my flower of love.
author: Anthony T. Hincks

desc: The glory of gardening: hands in the dirt, head in the sun, heart with nature. To nurture a garden is to feed not just the body, but the soul.
author: Alfred Austin

desc: The best tool in the garden is the knowledge of a gardener.
author: Unknown

desc: In joy or sadness, flowers are our constant friends.
author: Okakura Kakuzo

desc: A garden to walk in and immensity to dream in—what more could he ask? A few flowers at his feet and above him the stars.
author: Victor Hugo

desc: Love speaks in flowers. Truth requires thorns.
author: Leigh Bardugo

desc: You can learn a lot of things from the flowers.
author: Alice in Wonderland

desc: I need you (I need you) more than anyone, darlin’; You know that I have from the start. So build me up (build me up) buttercup, don’t break my heart.
author: The Foundations

desc: The flower that fades is not looked upon.
author: Edward Counsel

desc: You’re frustrated because you keep waiting for the blooming of flowers of which you have yet to sow the seeds.
author: Steve Maraboli

desc: He said that we belonged together because he was born with a flower, and I was born with a butterfly and that flowers and butterflies need each other for survival.
author: Gemma Malley

desc: If you love a flower which happens to be on a star, it is sweet at night to gaze at the sky. All the stars are a riot of flowers.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

desc: One person's weed is another person's wildflower.
author: Susan Wittig Albert
